Class com.bastel.democomp.ComponentListener 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----com.bastel.democomp.ComponentListener
public class ComponentListener
extends Object
implements Component
Implements the Component-Interface. This class may be used as base class for Components

Version:
0.1
Author:
Beno Kurmann, Michel Marti

fID
Identification (name) of the component

ComponentListener(String)
Add a foreign component as a Listener.

addListener(Component)
Add a foreign component as a Listener.
broadcast(Word, int)
Send a message containing a word and its address within a component to all listeners of this component
reset()
This method currently is empty and should be implemented by ComponentListener-Subclasses.
wordChanged(Word, int, String)
This message get's called from components we have registered ourself with

fID 
 protected String fID
Identification (name) of the component

ComponentListener 
 public ComponentListener(String id)
Add a foreign component as a Listener. Changes to data may then be transmitted to the Listeners by using the broadcast() method.

Parameters:
Component - Object to register as Listener

addListener 
 public void addListener(Component cmp) throws IllegalAccessException
Add a foreign component as a Listener. Changes to data may then be transmitted to the Listeners by using the broadcast() method.

Parameters:
Component - Object to register as Listener
broadcast 
 public void broadcast(Word word,
                       int address) throws IllegalAccessException
Send a message containing a word and its address within a component to all listeners of this component

Parameters:
word - Word to broadcast
address - Address of word within object
wordChanged 
 public void wordChanged(Word word,
                         int address,
                         String id) throws IllegalAccessException
This message get's called from components we have registered ourself with

Parameters:
word - Word sent by foreign component
address - Address of word within foreign component
id - ID of the foreign component
reset 
 public void reset() throws IOException
This method currently is empty and should be implemented by ComponentListener-Subclasses.
